abstract: The DealBook column on Tuesday, which pinned the blame of Facebook’s mess of an initial public offering on its chief financial officer, David Ebersman, has provoked a wide range of reactions among the online financial commentariat.
snippet: The DealBook column on Tuesday, which pinned the blame of Facebook’s mess of an initial public offering on its chief financial officer, David Ebersman, has provoked a wide range of reactions among the online financial commentariat.
lead_paragraph: My column on Tuesday, pinning the blame of Facebook’s mess of an initial public offering on its chief financial officer, David Ebersman, has caused quite a reaction — including Mark Cuban denouncing my view, saying “Facebook Handled their IPO Exactly Righ,t” and Forbes saying “The Man Responsible For Facebook’s Stock Debacle Is Mark Zuckerberg.”

headline.main: Who Is to Blame for Facebook’s I.P.O.? A Mix of Responses
